skill.name: literature-review
skill.description: Conduct comprehensive, systematic literature reviews using multiple academic databases (PubMed, arXiv, bioRxiv, Semantic Scholar, etc.). This skill should be used when conducting systematic literature reviews, meta-analyses, research synthesis, or comprehensive literature searches across biomedical, scientific, and technical domains. Creates professionally formatted markdown documents and PDFs with verified citations in multiple citation styles (APA, Nature, Vancouver, etc.).

skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains Python scripts that process user files and make HTTP requests to public DOI and CrossRef APIs for citation verification. The scripts invoke local tools (pandoc, xelatex) for PDF generation. No sensitive file access, environment harvesting, credential theft, or data exfiltration patterns were detected. The network activity is limited to legitimate academic API endpoints.

content.value_statement: You need a reproducible review process with accurate citations. This skill structures the workflow, verifies DOIs against official databases, and generates polished markdown and PDF outputs.
actual_capabilities: Deduplicate search results by DOI or title from JSON exports
Rank and filter results by citations count or publication year
Verify DOIs via doi.org and CrossRef APIs with metadata retrieval
Generate APA and Nature formatted citations from verified metadata
Export search results to markdown or BibTeX format
Create PDF documents from markdown using pandoc and xelatex
limitations: Does not perform database searches directly
Requires network access for DOI verification API calls
PDF generation needs pandoc and LaTeX engine installed locally
Citation formatting requires appropriate CSL style files

use_cases.title: Prepare thesis review
use_cases.description: Aggregate papers from multiple exports, verify DOIs, and format a clean literature review chapter.

use_cases.title: Audit search results
use_cases.description: Deduplicate and summarize multi-database exports for systematic review team workflows.

use_cases.title: Summarize research area
use_cases.description: Rank papers by citations and produce a literature scan with verified references.

prompt_templates.title: Start a review
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a step by step plan for a systematic literature review on gene therapy for sickle cell disease, including search strategy and screening criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Deduplicate results
prompt_templates.prompt: Process combined_results.json to deduplicate entries and output markdown with a summary of sources and year distribution.

prompt_templates.title: Verify citations
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify all DOIs in my_review.md and generate APA formatted citations for the verified entries.

prompt_templates.title: Generate PDF
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a PDF from my_review.md using Nature style citations with table of contents and numbered sections.

output: Generated APA reference list for verified entries
Saved detailed citation report alongside the markdown file

best_practices: Document every database search string and date for reproducibility
Run DOI verification before finalizing the review document
Use the review template to maintain consistent section structure
anti_patterns: Relying on a single database instead of multiple sources
Skipping DOI verification before publication submission
Summarizing studies individually instead of synthesizing themes

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, designed for those platforms using standard markdown workflows.

faq.question: What are the main limitations?
faq.answer: Does not search databases directly; depends on your exported JSON inputs.

faq.question: Can it integrate with other research tools?
faq.answer: Yes, consumes exports from PubMed, arXiv, Semantic Scholar, and other databases.

faq.question: Does it access or store sensitive data?
faq.answer: No; only reads files you provide and sends DOIs to public academic APIs.

faq.question: What if PDF generation fails?
faq.answer: Install pandoc and xelatex, then rerun with the check-deps option.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual reviews?
faq.answer: Improves citation accuracy and consistency; expert judgment still required for synthesis.
